resources.string: When screen off, long-pressing the volume rockers will seek music tracks
Play sound when adjusting volume with volumerocker
Kill the foreground app by long-pressing the back key
Show or change expanded desktop mode

These settings are included for experimentation and any changes made to them have the potential to cause instability, crashes, data loss or hardware failures.\n\nWe request you do not file bug reports if any of these settings have been changed from the defaults.
Change CPU governor and clock speed
Restore the processor settings on boot
Restore the I/O scheduler settings on boot
Customize the usage of memory to alter system performance
Compress memory for increased virtual capacity (requires reboot)
KSM reduces physical memory requirements and improves performance
Purging of bitmap memory assets allows the freeing of more RAM when needed (requires reboot)
Fix color banding and blur effect
Better graphics performance, but lower quality and may cause visual artifacts (requires reboot)
View or change the displayed buttons
View or change the order of the buttons
View or change the Brightness button modes
View or change the Sound button modes
Configure the hours the device should be quiet
Incoming calls will behave like usual during quiet hours
When to start enforcing quiet hours
When to stop enforcing quiet hours
Notification light will function as normal
Haptic feedback will function as normal
Show navigation and status bar transparency
Abbreviated day of the week before the time
Display custom date before the clock
Must be in DateFormat eg. MM/dd/yy
Adjust brightness by sliding across status bar
Please enter a new label. Enter an empty to revert to stock label.
Use custom application instead of the recent applications dialog
Show shortcuts in the notification drawer
Change the shorcuts icon color mode
Display the name of the currently connected Wifi network
View, select or change the layout of the displayed tiles
Dynamic tiles are not always visible and will only show up if triggered by a system event
%1$s edge of the status bar pulls down Quick Settings
Pulldown quick settings if no non-permanent notifications are present
Pulldown quick settings if no notifications are present
Close the Quick Settings panel upon toggle
Show or change Quick Settings style options
Landscape view doubles tiles per row quantity
Restore the default displayed tiles and layout?
Press on color below to apply
The charging animation may result in a poor user experience. Enable at your own discretion.
Enable TCP/IP debugging over network interfaces (Wi-Fi, USB networks). This setting is reset on reboot

WARNING: When ADB over network is enabled, your phone is open for intrusions on all connected networks, including GSM data network!

Only use this feature when you are connected on trusted networks.

Do you really want to enable this function?
Allowing applications to request root access is very dangerous and could compromise the security of your system!
View or change the lock screen settings
Drag the slider to targets to assign applications
View or change custom lock screen targets
Enable eight custom lock screen targets.\nNote: Changing this option resets your lock screen targets
Lock screen targets reset to default
Delete all user created lock screen targets and restore to default?
Select or change the desired application or activity and the associated icon
Lock screen will have the ability to rotate. This is dependent of Auto-rotation in display
System auto rotate is disabled. Enable it for this option.
View or change custom lock screen shortcuts
Open custom lock screen shortcuts on longpress
View or change lock screen security, delay and timeout settings
Pressing the menu button unlocks the device
Pressing the home button unlocks the device
Unlock automatically when the correct PIN/password is entered
Show slider lock screen before secure unlock mechanism
Default JB with invisible icons when hidden
Reset all style entries to default?
Reset all style and dimensions entries to default?
Where do you want the menu buttons to appear?
How and when do you want the menu buttons to appear?
Navigation bar height while in portrait.
Navigation bar height while in landscape.
Navigation bar height if the bar is along a side.
Shows navigation bar in lanscape on the bottom
Change the navigation bar button color mode
Show navigation and status bar transparency
To show up Widgets viewpager enable it in hardware keys, navigation bar buttons or navigation bar ring targets.
Add your custom widgets to the viewpager
Swipe to view - Click to choose
Widget shifted one position to the left
Widget shifted one position to the right
Widget cannot be shifted into this direction
Enable graphic effects disabled on lower end devices
Include options in the power menu for rebooting into recovery or bootloader
Prevents accidental unset of silent mode by pressing volume keys
Auto Hide statusbar if no non-permanent notifications are present
Auto Hide statusbar if no notifications are present
Only navigation will be displayed at top
Change the button icon color mode
Set gravity for left and right trigger
To avoid conflicts with status bar or navigation bar, the triggers on these edges are automatically turned off if one or both are visible
Disables and reduces trigger size near keyboard when active
Mirror right pie on the horizontal axis
Shows snap points to change the trigger edge dynamically
Shows phone status, time and date information
Enable or disable second button row
Peek at statusbar by swiping from top edge of screen
Maximum entries size has been reached
It is not possible to delete last entry
Disabled\nAdd an entry to enable this feature
The chosen app did not return a valid icon or does not support image cropping. Use another app
, while selecting the icon will bring up customization options

To add a %1$s, select the Add icon. Once a %1$s is added, selecting the row will change the target%2$s

To remove a %1$s, swipe the row horizontally left or right. Re-order a %1$s in the list by vertically dragging the anchor on the left.

To clear or reset to defaults, select the Reset icon.
Removing every %1$s in the list will disable the feature entirely.
